New Records: LeBron James and Bronny James became the first father and son to play in the NBA together.
LeBron James officially joined Vince Carter as the only players in NBA history to play in 22 seasons.
Key Match Events: Anthony Davis had 36 points and 16 rebounds in a dominant performance for the Lakers.
JJ Redick won his head coaching debut for the Lakers.
Anthony Edwards scored 27 points for the Timberwolves.
Julius Randle had 16 points and nine rebounds in his Timberwolves debut.
Donte DiVincenzo had 10 points in his Timberwolves debut.
Dalton Knecht scored five points in his Lakers debut.
Davis was phenomenal down the stretch, either scoring or assisting on 13 of Los Angeles’ next 15 points after he returned to the game with 7:09 left.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Timberwolves are coming off their best season in 20 years.
The Lakers' largely unchanged roster showed the benefits of continuity, playing disciplined ball on both ends and getting organized defense led by Davis.
